meanings.sent1: The city was suburbanising as more families moved to the outskirts.
meanings.sent2: People are suburbanising areas around the city for a quieter lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The neighborhood was suburbanising so quickly that even the squirrels seemed to prefer the new trees.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was suburbanising, expanding to embrace the peacefulness of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The idea of suburbanising their home brought a sense of calm and space to their busy lives.

meanings.sent1: Suburbanising has led to the creation of many new communities.
meanings.sent2: The suburbanising of the area brought in more shops and schools.
meanings.sent3: The rapid suburbanising of the town left the old mayor feeling out of place.
meanings.sent4: The suburbanising of the landscape painted a picture of growth and change.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of suburbanising lay in the sense of community it fostered among residents.
